intro: Tragopogon turcicus, commonly known as Turkish thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a robust taproot and upright stems with soft, hairy leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by the development of spiny, bristly seed heads. Tragopogon turcicus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
